user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of fill_v1_v2_form:
```c
static enum MHD_Result
fill_v1_v2_form (const void *cls,
                 const char *mime,
                 struct Session *session,
                 struct MHD_Connection *connection)
{
  enum MHD_Result ret;
  char *reply;
  struct MHD_Response *response;
  size_t slen;
  (void) cls; /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */

  slen = strlen (SECOND_PAGE) + strlen (session->value_1)
         + strlen (session->value_2);
  reply = malloc (slen + 1);
  if (NULL == reply)
    return MHD_NO;
  snprintf (reply,
            slen + 1,
            SECOND_PAGE,
            session->value_1,
            session->value_2);
  /* return static form */
  response =
    MHD_create_response_from_buffer_with_free_callback (slen,
                                                        (void *) reply,
                                                        &free);
  if (NULL == response)
  {
    free (reply);
    return MHD_NO;
  }
  add_session_cookie (session, response);
  if (MHD_YES !=
      MHD_add_response_header (response,
                               MHD_HTTP_HEADER_CONTENT_ENCODING,
                               mime))
  {
    fprintf (stderr,
             "Failed to set content encoding header!\n");
  }
  ret = MHD_queue_response (connection,
                            MHD_HTTP_OK,
                            response);
  MHD_destroy_response (response);
  return ret;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
add_session_cookie (session, response);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation in the shown fragment: calling add_session_cookie(session, response) is not recursion by itself. Rule 17.2 would be violated only if add_session_cookie (directly or via a call chain) calls fill_v1_v2_form again. For example, a violating scenario would be add_session_cookie -> some_helper -> fill_v1_v2_form (i.e. add_session_cookie invokes a function or callback that re-enters fill_v1_v2_form), creating indirect recursion.
